$!You can report someone to HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) if you think they're committing VAT fraud - you don't have to give your name.$!

You can report [VAT fraud online](https://online.hmrc.gov.uk/shortforms/form/CusConf_InformB?dept-name=Customs&sub-dept-name=Hotline&location=48&origin=http://www.hmrc.gov.uk "Customs Hotline"){:rel="external"} or by telephone. 

$C
**Customs 24 hour hotline**  
0800 595 000  
$C

For your own safety don't:

- try to find out more about the fraud
- let anyone know you're reporting it
- encourage anyone to commit a crime so you can get more information

##What is VAT fraud?

VAT fraud is when a business doesn't charge VAT when they should, or charges you VAT but doesn't pay it to HMRC. For example, they might:

- ask you to pay cash to avoid paying VAT on a sale or job
- not be registered for VAT when they should be
- use a VAT number that's false or belongs to someone else
- claim to have applied for a VAT number when they haven't

^You can [check a UK VAT number is valid.](http://ec.europa.eu/taxation_customs/vies/vatRequest.html "VIES VAT number validation"){:rel="external"}^

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
*[VAT]: Value Added Tax
